content: After participating in the Bitcoin Pumpkin Carving Contest. I made use of the pumpkin that I had carved. by cooking it with my wife.and throughout the cooking process my wife kept asking about bitcoin and also about this forum. maybe he was curious about what I did by carving a pumpkin slices with a bitcoin symbol. I also explained it and talked back a bit about bitcoin and this forum. we talked at length.and time passes unnoticed . the bitcoin pumpkin soup is cooked. and ready to serve.we serve it to the big family (my brothers). and we eat together. And because there are several pieces of pumpkin that are shaped like a bitcoin symbol. then all family members become talking about bitcoin. and my brother who talks the most about bitcoin. because he really became serious about studying bitcoin since I told him first. even his investment in bitcoin is way more than mine.The warmth is felt in my family.not in vain I entered the Bitcointalk Bitcoin Pumpkin Carving Contest. so I can eat pumpkin with my family and have a warm chat.these are the steps I took in cooking bitcoin pumpkin soup.Pumpkin splitSliced ‚Äã‚ÄãpumpkinPumpkin cooked with coconut milk on the stovebitcoin pumpkin soup is cooked and ready to be served and eaten with the family. ¬† And if you are curious about my pumpkin carving then please go to this link Re: üéÉ [ANN] Bitcointalk Bitcoin Pumpkin Carving Contest üéÉI also want to know have you ever talked about bitcoin with your family? and in what moment do you talk about it?

comments.author: Die_empty

comments.body: Quote from: Bazzu on October 28, 2022, 07:13:51 AMwow, what a cool thing you are doing, is cooking using a pumpkin that was used for a bitcoin carving contest. And your soup looks unique because the pumpkin you cook has a bitcoin engraving on it. hope you win the contest. and honestly, this is the first time I've seen a soup with a bitcoin logo on it.I also participated in the contest and it was my first time carving a pumpkin because it is a rare skill in my location. It was a very wonderful experience and I observed that my carving skills improved as I progressed.My parents when I was younger used to serve us pumpkin dishes which is called "anyi" in my local dialect. But my children have never eaten pumpkin meals in their entire life. This competition allowed me to prepare a local pumpkin dish for them.I boiled the pumpkin with salt and served it with pepper, palm oil, onions, and vegetables. I thought they would not enjoy it because these Gen Z generations are used to sweet and foreign dishes. I thought if they taste it, the dish would be returned to me. But I was wrong. They rushed the pumpkin meal and even had some disagreements in the course of eating.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: QuoteI also want to know have you ever talked about bitcoin with your family? and in what moment do you talk about it?I did have a conversation with my family about Bitcoin, I just can't remember how many times we had talked about it.¬† It all started when my parents are urging me to get a new job after I resigned from my previous job. They are very concerned since they always see me in front of my computer and seldom go outside.¬† I only go out when I have something important to buy or to do then the moment I got home, I am always in front of the computer.At first, my mom keep on nagging me that I had gone lazy and just wasted my education has no plans in my life because she thought that I am wasting my life sitting and playing games (little does she knows that I was learning the curve of cryptocurrency at that time).¬† I tried to explain it to her but she doesn't understand.¬† ¬†Of course, people won't listen if they don't see any results.¬† Even though my parents are not comfortable with what I am doing, they just let me be but often remind me about my future.¬† I always listen to what they are saying and when they are done nagging, I humbly explain my plan.¬† As usual, they have no faith in what I am doing but still, I keep persevering.Almost half a year had passed, and at last my effort come to fruition.¬† ¬†I had my first earnings in Bitcoin.¬† I happily give it to my mom and explained what happened.¬† This time she eagerly listened to my explanation.¬† The first earning is followed by another, and another.¬† The conversation about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency is now a normal thing in my family.¬† It is hard to make them understand in the beginning but the moment I show them the result, all their doubt about what I am doing disappeared.
